videos.headline: UNC's Black gets the and-1 layup
videos.description: Leaky Black takes matters into his own hands and drives to the basket for the and-1 lay-in.

tracking.trackingName: NCB_One Play (UNC's Black gets the and-1 layup) 2020/1/11

videos.headline: Dawes splashes a triple at the horn to end the half
videos.description: Clemson's Al-Amir Dawes sinks the 3-pointer at the buzzer to close the first half against North Carolina.

tracking.trackingName: NCB_One Play (Dawes splashes a triple at the horn to end the half) 2020/1/11

videos.headline: Bacot gets the steal and rocks the rim
videos.description: Armando Bacot forces the turnover and finishes the play with a two-handed jam.

tracking.trackingName: NCB_One Play (Bacot gets the steal and rocks the rim) 2020/1/11

videos.headline: Black swats Trapp's shot into the front row
videos.description: UNC's Leaky Black gets the big block on Clyde Trapp, sending his shot into the stands.

tracking.trackingName: NCB_One Play (Black swats Trapp's shot into the front row) 2020/1/11

videos.headline: Simms' clutch 3 sends Clemson into OT against UNC
videos.description: Clemson's Aamir Simms manages to sink a heavily contested triple to tie the game in the final seconds of regulation, sending the game into overtime.

tracking.trackingName: NCB_One Play (Simms' clutch 3 sends Clemson into OT against UNC) 2020/1/11

videos.headline: Brownell elated after Clemson's first-ever win at Chapel Hill
videos.description: Clemson upsets North Carolina in overtime, snapping a D-1 record 59-game road losing streak to a single opponent and improving to 1-59 all-time in Chapel Hill.

tracking.trackingName: NCB_One Play (Brownell elated after Clemson's first-ever win at Chapel Hill) 2020/1/11

videos.headline: Clemson drenches Brownell in locker room after historic win
videos.description: Clemson gets its first win in Chapel Hill ever, and the team doesn't hold back with the celebration in the locker room.

tracking.trackingName: COM_NCB Misc. (Clemson drenches Brownell in locker room after historic win) 2020/01/11 3PV ESHEET

videos.headline: Williams calls Clemson loss his 'lowest moment' as a coach
videos.description: An emotional Roy Williams takes the blame for UNC's home loss to Clemson, saying his coaching at the end of regulation is the "biggest regret" of his career.

tracking.trackingName: NCB_Presser (Williams calls Clemson loss his 'lowest moment' as a coach) 2020/01/11

article.description: Aamir Simms hit an overtime-forcing 3-pointer with 3.5 seconds left in regulation and Clemson went on to erase decades of futility at North Carolina by beating the Tar Heels 79-76 on Saturday, earning their first win in 60 tries in Chapel Hill.

video.headline: Simms puts Clemson ahead in OT with clutch lay-in
video.caption: Aamir Simms drops in a clutch layup to give Clemson a late lead in overtime against North Carolina.
video.description: Aamir Simms drops in a clutch layup to give Clemson a late lead in overtime against North Carolina.

video.title: Simms puts Clemson ahead in OT with clutch lay-in

article.headline: Clemson stuns UNC 79-76 in OT, earns 1st win in Chapel Hill

images.name: Simms puts Clemson ahead in OT with clutch lay-in
images.caption: Aamir Simms drops in a clutch layup to give Clemson a late lead in overtime against North Carolina.

article.linkText: Clemson stuns UNC 79-76 in OT, earns 1st win in Chapel Hill
article.story: CHAPEL HILL, N.C. -- Year after year, every Clemson team that played at North Carolina left the court in the same fashion: by throwing another loss onto what had grown into a bizarrely long streak. No longer. For once, the Tigers were the ones celebrating in Chapel Hill at Saturday's final horn while the Tar Heels were left to ponder a late collapse to add to their recent struggles. Aamir Simms hit an overtime-forcing 3-pointer with 3.5 seconds left in regulation and Clemson went on to erase decades of futility at North Carolina by beating the Tar Heels 79-76, earning their first win in 60 tries in Chapel Hill. "We're certainly glad to have it past us and not be asked about it any more," coach Brad Brownell said, "and we can move on to other things that we need to accomplish in our program." Simms finished with 20 points for the Tigers (8-7, 2/3 Atlantic Coast Conference), who trailed by 10 with a little more than two minutes left in regulation. But Clemson made a frantic comeback to force the extra period, then came up with enough key baskets to do what no other predecessor had done in school history. Clemson's streak began in 1926 and had reached 0-59 to give the Tar Heels (8-8, 1-4) an NCAA record for the longest home winning streak against once opponent. All that pent-up frustration spilled out at the horn, with Tigers players running to midcourt to celebrate while John Newman III wrapped Brownell in an engulfing hug. "A lot of excitement, just a lot of excitement," Newman said. "I've never hugged coach like that before." That celebration continued all the way to the Tigers locker room, too, with Brownell exchanging high-fives with players outside in a celebration that was still audible as UNC coach Roy Williams held his postgame news conference a few doors away. Simms added a critical driving basket with 18.1 seconds left in OT, then the Tigers got a final stop when Garrison Brooks and then Brandon Robinson both missed tying 3-pointers on the final possession. Robinson's miss had the senior lying on the court as the Tigers launched their celebration despite his career-best 27 points. Williams -- who remains tied with late mentor Dean Smith for fourth on the Division I men's career coaching wins list with 879 victories -- took blame for the loss, saying he forgot to tell his players to foul late so Simms couldn't launch the tying 3. "I'd tell (athletics director Bubba Cunningham) he should probably fire me, it probably wouldn't be a bad idea," Williams said, folding up a stat sheet to put in his jacket pocket. "The coach is supposed to help his kids. I didn't help them very much." BIG PICTURE Clemson: Beyond the long run of bad history here, the Tigers were trying to win consecutive games for the first time since starting 5-1. And they looked on their way to another frustrating loss in Chapel Hill when they trailed 68-58 with 2:08 left, only to complete an improbable turnaround by forcing some turnovers with fullcourt pressure and hitting some big shots to make history. "It's definitely good," Simms said of going to 1-59 in Chapel Hill, "but the number still looks crazy." UNC: The Tar Heels were struggling with their worst record through 15 games under Williams. And they were battered entering this one, from top player Cole Anthony missing his seventh straight game following knee surgery to the pregame announcement that freshman point guard Jeremiah Francis wouldn't play due to left-knee soreness. Williams said Friday he doesn't say much about the streak with his team beyond noting it has to end at some point and the goal should be to "try to put it off another year." And now, that run is over. THE FINAL SHOT Simms said "my heart stopped" when Robinson launched the tying 3-pointer to force a second overtime. "I'm just watching the ball like in the movies, just going in slow motion," Simms said. "I'm just watching it go, and when I saw it hit the back rim, all I could think was, `I'll have to run and find somebody on my team so I could give them a hug.' It's something I'll never forget in my life." TAKING RESPONSIBILITY While Williams blamed himself for the loss, Brooks put it on the players. "I respect it, I understand what he meant," Brooks said. "We didn't make plays, players didn't make plays at the end. We turned the ball over a lot. That's it, he wasn't out there turning the ball over." UP NEXT Clemson: The Tigers host No. 2 Duke on Tuesday. UNC: The Tar Heels visit Pittsburgh next Saturday. --- More AP college basketball: http://apnews.com/Collegebasketball and http://www.twitter.com/AP-Top25 --- Follow Aaron Beard on Twitter at http://www.twitter.com/aaronbeardap

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).
